intro: Scaevola macraei, commonly known as the pink fairy fan, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its vibrant pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, forming a fan-like shape. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils. Scaevola macraei is a popular ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
